alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 7:16PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Monroe and south central Wilcox Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 715 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Camden, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Neenah and McWilliams. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
